intro: Tetractomia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf tetractomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
